importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners in the ALCS, forcing Game 7 and marking a pivotal moment in the 2025 postseason.
The date on which the Blue Jays' Game 7 win in the ALCS was finalized, setting the stage for the World Series matchup.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period between Game 2 and Game 7, during which the Mariners' performance declined and the Blue Jays' momentum grew, culminating in a decisive Game 7.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run in the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and sealing the series.
The Seattle Mariners committed three errors in the game, including two in the second inning, which allowed early runs and contributed to the Blue Jays' 6-2 victory.
Addison Barger and Isiah Kiner-Falefa drove in runs with back-to-back singles after the errors, giving Toronto an early 2-0 lead.
Josh Naylor homered in the sixth inning to score a run, giving the Mariners a brief lead before the Blue Jays retook control.
Matt Brash's wild pitch in the seventh inning allowed Guerrero Jr. to score, extending the lead to 6-2 and forcing a Game 7.
Addison Yesavage, a 2024 first-round pick, delivered a strong pitching performance with 31 splitters, seven strikeouts, and only six hits and three walks.
The Blue Jays have not played a Game 7 since 1985, making this their first such appearance since then.
The Mariners' history includes only one Game 7 appearance in their history, making this their first such encounter.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, 2025.
The game was notable for both offensive dominance and defensive mistakes, highlighting the intensity of playoff baseball.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his sixth home run in the postseason, a key moment that extended the Blue Jays’ lead and helped force Game 7 of the ALCS, showcasing his impact in high-stakes playoff play.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a decisive Game 7 in the ALCS, marking a significant milestone in their playoff history.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They were defeated 6-2 in Game 7, marking their first-ever Game 7 appearance in franchise history and demonstrating a historic playoff struggle.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is the key context for the matchup between the Blue Jays and Mariners, culminating in a Game 7 that will determine the AL representative for the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are the National League champions and will face the ALCS winner in the World Series, making them the final destination of this playoff series.

namedEntities.name: Addison Yesavage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched effectively in the game, throwing 31 splitters and allowing only six hits and three walks, helping secure a victory for the Mariners despite their errors.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodríguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He committed a fielding error on a single from Daulton Varsho, contributing to early offensive opportunities for the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Eugenio Suárez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He made a critical error on a groundball from Ernie Clement, leading to a run and a pivotal moment in the early innings of the game.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored on a fielding error from Julio Rodríguez, initiating the Blue Jays’ early offensive surge.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that led to a fielding error by Eugenio Suárez, resulting in a run for the Blue Jays.

namedEntities.name: Isiah Kiner-Falefa
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored a run with a single in the second inning, contributing to the Blue Jays’ early 2-0 lead.

namedEntities.name: Matt Brash
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He threw a wild pitch in the seventh inning that allowed Vladimir Guerrero Jr. to score, extending the Blue Jays’ lead to 6-2 and forcing Game 7.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason as the Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2, forcing a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners committed three errors—two in the second inning—leading to early runs, including back-to-back RBI singles by Addison Barger and Isiah Kiner-Falefa. A two-run homer by Barger and a solo shot by Guerrero Jr. in the fifth inning extended the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0. Though Josh Naylor homered in the sixth to score a run, a wild pitch by Matt Brash in the seventh allowed Guerrero Jr. to score, making the final score 6-2 and sending the series to a Game 7. This marks the first time the Mariners have played a Game 7 in history, while the Blue Jays’ first such appearance since 1985. The winner of the series will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday, 2025.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
